decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill your graveyard with cards using cards like Faithless Looting and Shriekhorn, then use cards like Life from the Loam to continually bring back key cards like Prized Amalgam and Bloodghast from the graveyard. The goal is to create a loop of strong creatures that can overwhelm your opponent, while also utilizing cards like Creeping Chill and Conflagrate for additional damage and disruption. The deck aims to set up a powerful board presence and quickly close out the game with explosive combos.

This deck focuses on aggressively reducing your own life total in order to power up Death's Shadow and Gurmag Angler quickly, utilizing cards like Thoughtseize, Street Wraith, and Dismember to achieve this. It also includes disruption spells like Stubborn Denial and Fatal Push to control the opponent's board while trying to close out the game as quickly as possible with powerful threats. The deck aims to put pressure on the opponent early on and maintain that pressure throughout the game to secure a victory.

The deck focuses on utilizing a tribe of powerful and synergistic Human creatures to overwhelm the opponent quickly. By utilizing cards like Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish to power up the team, along with disruptive cards like Meddling Mage and Kitesail Freebooter to control the opponent's plays, the deck aims to maintain a strong, aggressive board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for quick deployment of creatures, making it difficult for the opponent to keep up with the onslaught of threats.

This deck focuses on aggressively playing a variety of Human creatures with abilities that disrupt opponent strategies while rapidly building up a strong board presence. The combination of Aether Vial and mana-fixing lands allows for quick and consistent plays, while cards like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben hinder opponents' spell casting. With Thalia's Lieutenant and Champion of the Parish getting stronger as more Humans enter the battlefield, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a swarm of creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Meddling Mage and Reflector Mage.

This deck focuses on assembling UrzaTron (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of colorless mana quickly. The deck includes various ways to search for and assemble the Tron lands, along with powerful control elements like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated. The win conditions are massive threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon. The deck aims to control the game with removal and disruption until it can establish a dominant board presence and overwhelm the opponent.

This deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures like Tarmogoyf and Bloodbraid Elf while disrupting the opponent with hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. It also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Abrupt Decay to deal with opposing threats. The plan is to pressure the opponent quickly while controlling the board with a mix of proactive and reactive cards. The deck aims to outpace and outvalue the opponent in the early to mid-game, leveraging its versatile card selection and efficient threats to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to maintain control of the game by using counterspells, removal spells, and efficient card draw. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan, control the board with removal spells like Supreme Verdict and Path to Exile, and generate card advantage with cards like Teferi, Hero of Dominaria and Cryptic Command. The deck also utilizes land destruction with Field of Ruin and disruption with Spreading Seas to limit the opponent's resources. Ultimately, the goal is to outvalue and outlast the opponent until a win condition can be established.

This deck focuses on using instant reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach to cheat out powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Worldspine Wurm early in the game. The deck also includes cards like Nourishing Shoal and Desperate Ritual to help generate mana quickly. By utilizing these combo pieces effectively, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with big creatures and strong card draw engines, allowing for explosive plays and quick wins. The key strategy is to quickly set up the combo and disrupt opponents before they have a chance to respond.

The key concept of this deck is to aggressively utilize cards like Death's Shadow, Gurmag Angler, and Snapcaster Mage to quickly reduce the opponent's life total while disrupting their hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and Dismember, while also utilizing counter spells like Stubborn Denial to protect their threats. By combining efficient threats with disruptive spells and card advantage engines like Jace, Vryn's Prodigy and Thought Scour, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to stall and control the game until it reaches enough mana to cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger. The deck utilizes the UrzaTron lands to quickly assemble the required mana while using cards like Ancient Stirrings and Sylvan Scrying to find the necessary pieces. It also includes cards like Oblivion Stone and Relic of Progenitus to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan. The end goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and control effects.

This deck focuses on aggressive, burn spells and efficient creatures to deal direct damage to the opponent. It aims to quickly deplete the opponent's life total before they can stabilize or mount a defense. The key strategy is to consistently apply pressure with creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear while using spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Exquisite Firecraft to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes countermagic like Remand to disrupt the opponent's plans and protect its own threats.

This Dredge deck focuses on filling the graveyard quickly to utilize cards like Bloodghast, Narcomoeba, and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Faithless Looting and Cathartic Reunion, the player can draw and discard cards to bring back creatures and deal damage with Conflagrate. Life from the Loam helps to maintain a strong graveyard presence, while Creeping Chill provides additional reach. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a steady stream of threats from the graveyard, utilizing dredge mechanics to continuously bring back creatures and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The key concept of this deck is to quickly assemble a board state with Puresteel Paladin and Sram, Senior Edificer equipped with zero-cost equipment such as Paradise Mantle and Sigil of Distinction. By tapping these equipped creatures to draw cards and generate mana, the deck aims to cycle through the deck efficiently and find a win condition with Grapeshot or a massive creature with Retract. Using cards like Noxious Revival and Hurkyl's Recall to protect the combo, the deck can overwhelm opponents with a storm of artifacts and spells.

The main concept of this deck is to use cards like Faithless Looting, Life from the Loam, and Cathartic Reunion to quickly fill up your graveyard with cards like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug. Then, you can use cards like Creeping Chill and Prized Amalgam to bring creatures back to the battlefield from the graveyard. This deck aims to overwhelm your opponent with a constant stream of creatures and damage from the graveyard, making it difficult for them to keep up.

The deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a significant amount of mana quickly. It aims to control the game by utilizing powerful removal spells like Oblivion Stone and Dismember, while also searching for key cards with Expedition Map and Ancient Stirrings. The deck includes powerful threats like Wurmcoil Engine, Walking Ballista, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, as well as planeswalkers like Karn Liberated and Ugin, the Spirit Dragon to take over the game once the Tron lands are assembled.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly fill the graveyard with instants and sorceries to bring back powerful threats like Arclight Phoenix. It aims to aggressively cast spells and flip Thing in the Ice, while also utilizing cards like Pyromancer Ascension and Crackling Drake for additional value. Surgical Extraction is included for disruption, while Snapcaster Mage provides additional spell recursion. The deck seeks to constantly pressure the opponent with efficient spells and creatures, overwhelming them with a high tempo playstyle.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. This mana is then used to cast powerful colorless threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes ways to tutor for the UrzaTron lands and other key cards to ensure consistency in executing its game plan, while also including removal and graveyard hate to disrupt the opponent's plans.

This deck focuses on utilizing graveyard interactions to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures and then return them to the battlefield, triggering powerful effects like Prized Amalgam and Creeping Chill. The key strategy is to continually dredge cards from the library into the graveyard, while using cards like Cathartic Reunion and Faithless Looting to keep the engine going. By effectively managing the graveyard and utilizing synergistic interactions, this combo deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a powerful board presence and efficient resource utilization.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly generate mana and draw cards by equipping cheap artifacts to Puresteel Paladin and Sram, Senior Edificer. With the ability to quickly cycle through the deck, the player can find win conditions such as Monastery Mentor and Grapeshot to close out the game. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Hurkyl's Recall and Repeal to control the board while gaining advantage. By combining card draw, fast mana generation, and disruption, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) to generate large amounts of mana quickly. This mana is used to cast powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Ugin, the Spirit Dragon, and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, while also providing flexibility with cards like Warping Wail and Oblivion Stone for control purposes. The deck also includes card filtering and searching tools like Ancient Stirrings and Expedition Map to help find key pieces and ensure consistency in executing its game plan.
